### Change is on previous commit
#### Edit first line
a b c d e -> z b c d e
z b c d e

#### Edit in middle
a b c d e -> a b z d e
a b z d e

#### Edit last line
a b c d e -> a b c d z
a b c d z


### Change is on 2nd previous commit
#### Edit first line
a b c d e   -> z b c d e
a b c d e f -> z b c d e f
z b c d e f

#### Edit in middle
a b c d e   -> a b z d e
a b c d e f -> a b z d e f
a b z d e f

#### Edit last line
a b c d e -> a b c d z
a b f c d e -> a b f c d z
a b f c d z


### Progressive
#### Edit first line
a -> z
a b -> z b
a b c -> z b c
z b c

#### Edit in middle
a
a b
a b c -> a b z
a b c d -> a b z d
a b c d e -> a b z d e
a b z d e

#### Edit last line
a
a b
a b c -> a b z
a b z


### Progressive from end
#### Edit first line
c
b c
a b c -> z b c
z b c

#### Edit in middle
e
d e
c d e -> z d e
b c d e -> b z d e
a b c d e -> a b z d e
a b z d e

#### Edit last line
c -> z
b c -> b z
a b c -> a b z
a b z

### TODO: Check when there is no final new_line and when there are
### TODO: Check when there are duplicate lines, either consecutive or not (SKIP)



a b c d e
a b z d e
a x z y e

# This is tricky, z and y are changes to the same previous commit, and the same chunk of changes.
# But we have since removed part of that shared chunk in the middle. So this can't be applied as a single commit/fixup
# However, if we do each one individually, it makes sense to work...
a b c d e
a b d e
a z y e
